intro: Rubus clavaudii, commonly known as the Clavaud’s blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically edible. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Rubus clavaudii is often found in shrublands and rocky areas, contributing to local biodiversity.
